intro: Cacalia serrata, commonly known as the serrated cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cacalia serrata is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and modest blooms.
